util.ui

Class PivotSwingUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • util.ui.PivotSwingUtils

  • public class PivotSwingUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class containing stuff to help with both Swing and Pivot, and especially to make the transition between them more smooth
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    EPICI

      static <T> T loadBxml(java.lang.Class<?> source, java.lang.String filename)
      Convenient shortcut for loading BXML
      static <T> T loadBxml(java.lang.Class<?> source, java.lang.String filename, org.apache.pivot.beans.BXMLSerializer serializer)
      Convenient shortcut for loading BXML
      Uses the given BXMLSerializer instead of a new instance, which has its uses
      Note that if it fails, the BXMLSerializer gets messed up, so if this returns null and the BXMLSerializer is intended to be reused, make a new one and be sure to copy all the data from the original one
      static boolean showFrameDefault(javax.swing.JInternalFrame frame)
      Pops open the frame, if it exists
      static javax.swing.JInternalFrame wrapPivotWindow(org.apache.pivot.wtk.Window pivotWindow)
      Creates a JInternalFrame with the content of the Pivot Window or something like that.

    • Method Detail

      • loadBxml

        public static <T> T loadBxml(java.lang.Class<?> source,
                             java.lang.String filename)
        Convenient shortcut for loading BXML
        Type Parameters:
        T - the desired type
        Parameters:
        source - a class, resource should be in the same folder
        filename - the name of the file to open
        Returns:
        an object of the correct type if successful, otherwise null

      • loadBxml

        public static <T> T loadBxml(java.lang.Class<?> source,
                             java.lang.String filename,
                             org.apache.pivot.beans.BXMLSerializer serializer)
        Convenient shortcut for loading BXML
        Uses the given BXMLSerializer instead of a new instance, which has its uses
        Note that if it fails, the BXMLSerializer gets messed up, so if this returns null and the BXMLSerializer is intended to be reused, make a new one and be sure to copy all the data from the original one
        Type Parameters:
        T - the desired type
        Parameters:
        source - a class, resource should be in the same folder
        filename - the name of the file to open
        serializer - the serializer object to use
        Returns:
        an object of the correct type if successful, otherwise null

        Pops open the frame, if it exists
        Parameters:
        frame - the JInternalFrame to show
        Returns:
        true if successful

        Creates a JInternalFrame with the content of the Pivot Window or something like that.
        Magic.
        Parameters:
        pivotWindow - an Apache Pivot Window
        Returns:
        a Swing JInternalFrame
